author: Philip Wilson
title: Music Industry Money Made Fair
description: Musicians / crew can't track/recieve royalties and touring payments all over the world. Centralised systems have never changed since the 60s

assessments.note:
I did not understand what the problem is. Something is done unchanged since the 60s and suddenly it needs to change. 
I did not understand what the proposed solution would do. Uber for something.
This could be a great idea, but there is not enough detail in the plan to evaluate what would actually be provided.

A blockchain solution for the music industry is highly desirable and would meet the challenge.  However there is a lot of competition in the space and it would take an exceptional team to have a impact.

The problem statement makes sense and is reasonable. There is potential for a dapp to fulfill this need, but there is no plan for how this will be accomplished and there are no metrics or goals that indicate the impact of the proposal on this challenge and for Cardano. Without a plan, it is not possible to indicate impact and if the proposal addresses the challenge.

There is a definite need for more visibility in the music industry which your proposal addresses and has some solid ideas to benefit everyone involved. You clearly need to develop this idea further which I will explain in the next two notes. Also, I think you should consider how NFT development for artists can be incorporated in the next proposal.

Developing an app for live music events, where crews and musicians would be paid through the Cardano blockchain could prove beneficial for the ecosystem. But the proposal is too short and not too descriptive, so it would be hard to say exactly how it would turn out and whether it would pull in more adoption

I believe that this proposal is very innovative and interesting. Indeed, the music industry is very bureaucratic, often as record companies and copyright holders (whether composing, reproducing, selling, etc.) profit from the work of artists, who lose their autonomy and decision-making power. If the financial transactions of contracts, products, copyrights and etc. were made via ADA, it would increase transparency and security for artists and could somehow (which I didn't quite understand) benefit the public itself.

Certainly the proposal addresses the challenge and received good interaction with the community. There may be some proposals already in progress but it is difficult to gauge where they are up to in development so in no way does that rule out this proposal. I would highly recommend that the author continue to research collaborations with others in the CP community to look for potential niche areas and/or team forming to go forward.

The proposal aims to adapt the unified  Cardano payment system for people involved in organizing live music events. Organizing live music involves a large number of support troops like lights, sound, etc. One common application with a unified payment will improve the handling of organizers' handling with ticket sales as NFT can add value.
Industry experience is there, which is very good. However no requirements and no implementation team yet. This gives me low confidence in success.

There is no detailed plan and the proposers does not have the technical knowledge to build it. It is unlikely it would be successful without at least first developing a detailed plan and budget with milestones

The proposer has music industry experience but would depend on finding a team to complete the project. Not a lot of thought has been given to the technical aspects of the application or the marketing strategy. I think the proposal would appear more feasible if there was an assembled team, some defined goals, and a strategy for gaining traction in the industry.

The proposer described experience in the music industry, but the execution of this project requires developers, but there is no detail on how many developers will be needed and their expertise.

To evaluate the feasibility of the proposal, a solid plan is needed. How was the budget defined? There is no detail or rationale to justify a budget of $ 100,000.

I recommend detailing the plan and including the items mentioned in the Catalyst documentation.

Your 20-30 years of experience would certainly be beneficial as would the connections to famous rock stars, but the details for this proposal are lacking. I need to see a clear cost analysis of how that 100k will be spent. This is a major undertaking with the possibility to introduce Cardano to a major market. I believe waiting for smart contracts to be deployed will be critical for this proposal to be implemented successfully.

The proposer does not provide any links to his prior experience. He states he is not a developer, yet he makes up a budget for a dApp development without any cost description or developer quotas or anything else for that matter.

The author is able to carry out the project in terms of music, as he has worked with it before. Having a command of how the relationships in question work is fundamental. However, it would be beneficial if the author showed himself with the intention of forming a team with both programming professionals, designers and people specialized in transactions via ADA to complete his project, since he does not appear to have experience in this part. So, not a lot of security is passed in relation to a whole about realizing the idea, unfortunately.

The author has excellent music industry experience but admits he will require developers to bring the Dapp to fruition. This needs to be further along to receive a higher score for planning. The budget lacks any real detail so difficult to assess how the budget will be spent.

The proposer claims to have 30 years experience in music industry as tour manager and in other roles. The proposer is having limited experience in managing software development and will require a team to handle the same. No verifiable credentials of the proposer in this respect are enclosed in the proposal .
While music industry experience would be valuable in gaining attention after the DApp is completed, I see no experience in writing code at all or any plan to hire the needed help.

No requirements, but a platform is promised within 12 months. No success criteria either. It would probably be advisable to split the project in phases and do the requirements gathering first. Success criteria would then be whether the subsequent design and build phases get funding.
More detail required to asses feasibility. Currently it is an idea, not a feasible proposal.

a large amount is requested and there is no breakdown of fund allocation into steps or checkpoints. There are no specific goals proposed except a vague "product in 12 months". I dont see any way to audit this project or have confidence that Catalyst funds are used successfully.
There is no information to allow audibility. I recommend including this information according to the Catalyst documentation.

I fully agree the need and benefit of live music, but developing the platform vaguely described as "Uber for music" is not enough. People have developed a fear of crowds and many venues will have to adjust to this new normal. A focus on outdoor venues should be considered. Please continue to make connections and learn more about the DApp creation framework so you can provide more details if you submit another proposal. I need to see clear goals for 3, 6, 9 months in and can not just rely on a 12 month development window.

The proposal does not include any budget details, any prior experience, any metrics or any detailed description for the project. Hard to assess, I strongly recommend re-applying for a future fund but with a complete proposal.

There is practically no information on how the idea would develop in practice, because there is no action plan for the text the author wrote. There is no division of parts, a plan of goals for a certain period of time, an explanation regarding how the money would be divided and used (this is quoted in a very vague way)… We only know that the intention is to create a unique token for the transactions in question, but it is not enough to establish a sense of how the project would come true, unfortunately.

The proposal certainly received positive contributions from the community however, there is a lack of real detail to the information supplied. While it seems valid to suggest there is a need for such a Dapp in the music industry, it was unclear whether this proposal is the answer at this stage. I would recommend further refinement of the proposal with emphasis on collaboration, team building and better budget description.

Monitoring the development of applications is possible.  However, the proposal has limited information on how the development will be carried out. The proposer will be dependent on a team to come up for building the application, likely

For the amount of money being asked for, much more information is needed to justify this price point. With the given  information, I do not see this proposal coming to light in 12 months. Even if a UI and basic DApp was created in the time, I still do not have confidence based on the available information and cannot recommend this project.

solution: Develop an industry app, like Uber for music. Crew, merch people, venues etc can all promote themselves in one place, with Cardano payment
experience: 30 years in the music industry as a musican, guitar builder and tour manager. I have personally worked with many world Publishing agencies.
